name: @microfox/youtube-analytics
title: Youtube Analytics V3
description: A TypeScript SDK for interacting with the YouTube Analytics V3 API. Supports functionalities such as retrieving analyticsreports, managing groups and group items.  Provides methods for getReports, listGroups, insertGroup, updateGroup, deleteGroup, listGroupItems, insertGroupItem, deleteGroupItem, refreshAccessToken, and validateAccessToken.

constructors.name: YoutubeAnalyticsSDK
constructors.description: Create a new Youtube Analytics SDK client through which you can interact with the API

internalKeys.description: The access token for authenticating with the YouTube Analytics API.
The refresh token used to obtain a new access token when the current one expires.
The client ID of your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The client secret of your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The redirect URI configured for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The scopes required by the SDK

extraInfo:
To use the YouTube Analytics SDK, follow these steps:

1. Set up a Google Cloud Project:
   - Go to the Google Cloud Console (https://console.cloud.google.com/)
   - Create a new project or select an existing one
   - Enable the YouTube Analytics API for your project

2. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials:
   - In the Google Cloud Console, go to "APIs & Services" > "Credentials"
   - Click "Create Credentials" and select "OAuth client ID"
   - Choose "Web application" as the application type
   - Set the authorized redirect URIs (include your application's callback URL)
   - Note down the Client ID and Client Secret

3. Set up environment variables:
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: Your OAuth 2.0 client secret
   - GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI: Your application's redirect URI

4. Install the SDK:
   ```
   npm install @yourdomain/youtube-analytics-sdk
   ```

5. Initialize the SDK:
   ```typescript
   import { createYoutubeAnalyticsSDK } from '@yourdomain/youtube-analytics-sdk';

   const sdk = createYoutubeAnalyticsSDK({
     accessToken: 'YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN',
     refreshToken: 'YOUR_REFRESH_TOKEN',
     clientId: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID!,
     clientSecret: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET!,
     redirectUri: process.env.GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI!,
   });
   ```

6. Use the SDK methods to interact with the YouTube Analytics API:
   ```typescript
   const reports = await sdk.getReports({
     ids: 'channel==MINE',
     startDate: '2023-01-01',
     endDate: '2023-12-31',
     metrics: 'views,likes,dislikes',
   });
   ```

Important notes:
- Ensure you have the necessary OAuth scopes for the operations you want to perform.
- The SDK automatically handles token validation and refreshing.
- Be aware of YouTube Analytics API quotas and rate limits (https://developers.google.com/youtube/analytics/v2/quota)
- For detailed API documentation, refer to the official YouTube Analytics API documentation (https://developers.google.com/youtube/analytics)

Error handling:
- The SDK throws errors for invalid inputs, API errors, and authentication issues.
- Always wrap SDK method calls in try-catch blocks to handle potential errors gracefully.

Security best practices:
- Never hardcode or expose your Client ID, Client Secret, or tokens in client-side code.
- Use secure storage for tokens and refresh them as needed.
- Implement proper OAuth 2.0 flow for obtaining and managing tokens.

To use the YouTube Analytics SDK, follow these steps:

1. Set up a Google Cloud Project:
   - Go to the Google Cloud Console (https://console.cloud.google.com/)
   - Create a new project or select an existing one
   - Enable the YouTube Analytics API for your project

2. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials:

   - Click "Create Credentials" and select "OAuth client ID"
   - Choose "Web application" as the application type

   - Note down the Client ID and Client Secret

3. Set up environment variables:
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: Your OAuth 2.0 client secret
   - GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI: Your application's redirect URI

   ```
   npm install @yourdomain/youtube-analytics-sdk
   ```

   ```typescript

     ids: 'channel==MINE',
   ```

Important notes:

- The SDK automatically handles token validation and refreshing.
- Be aware of YouTube Analytics API quotas and rate limits (https://developers.google.com/youtube/analytics/v2/quota)

- The SDK throws errors for invalid inputs, API errors, and authentication issues.

Security best practices:
- Never hardcode or expose your Client ID, Client Secret, or tokens in client-side code.
- Use secure storage for tokens and refresh them as needed.
- Implement proper OAuth 2.0 flow for obtaining and managing tokens.
